name: NASA (Interstellar)
description: A secretive organization in the film 'Interstellar' focused on finding a new habitable planet for humanity.

content.title: Overview
content.body: NASA (Interstellar) is a governmental organization that operates covertly to address the planetary crisis facing Earth. Its primary goal is to explore space for a new home for humanity amid ecological collapse on Earth.

content.title: History
content.body: NASA operates in hiding after public information about space travel is suppressed due to budget cuts and a focus on Earth's immediate crises. Led by Professor Brand, NASA secretly works on the Endurance mission to find a habitable planet outside of Earth's solar system.

content.title: Structure
content.body: The organization is led by **Professor Brand**, who coordinates missions from their secret facility. Key members include astronauts such as **Cooper** and **Amelia Brand**. The organization has a hierarchical structure with dedicated divisions for mission planning and execution.

content.title: Operations
content.body: NASA (Interstellar) focuses on the execution of the Endurance mission, which includes the use of spacecraft such as the **Endurance**, **Ranger**, and **Lander** to explore potential planets near a wormhole located close to Saturn. Their operations involve advanced science and exploration of space-time mechanics to find a viable planet for colonization.

content.title: Story Significance
content.body: NASA plays a crucial role in 'Interstellar', as it is the driving force behind the mission to save humanity. It is central to the film's narrative, plotting a course through a wormhole to evaluate potentially habitable planets and tackle existential threats posed by environmental degradation on Earth.
